primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The emergence of peace through odd human agents who, empowered by the Spirit, break cycles of injustice to restore creation.

tekstueel_bewijs: The peacemaker is an odd human agent.
one who comes from God, a human agent, for peace depends on human agents
this odd, unexpected agent of newness intervenes in situations of inequity
the dividend of peace spills over

zender.identificatie: The Spirit of the Lord (The Wind)
tekstueel_bewijs: The spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him
powered and driven and authorized by God’s spirit
both the fearful children and the awesome snakes have a new chance
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly invited to identify with the Subject (the odd agent).

tekstueel_bewijs: a special plus given beyond human capacity
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Helper/Sender (the fuel), while Man is the Subject (the engine).
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that pushes the human outside of themselves.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is defined as systemic inertia and psychological habits rather than a cosmic or ontological power that requires a divine Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The restoration of the Cosmos (The Peace Dividend).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Human Agent's act of justice
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The cosmic restoration is presented as a 'ripple effect' or 'dividend' of the human act of peacemaking.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The spirit of the LORD shall rest upon him
God smiled with me in the newness
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we need not look for it there

voorbeelden: I knew what I had to do
Who wants to be a stump?
I decided that I wanted to make a stand
so that it knows where to look

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'empowerment' of the human subject. It assumes the human knows the 'ought' but needs the 'power' (Spirit) to act.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Injustice) to ~S1 (Normalcy) to ~S2 (Odd Action) to S1 (Peace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through human 'intervention' fueled by the 'Wind'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a systemic habit rather than a terminal condition of the soul.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While using the language of 'Spirit' and 'Gift', the sermon is structurally anthropocentric. The human agent is the Subject of the change; God is the Helper (the Wind) that enables the human to perform the work of peace.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: peace will not be done by God from heaven... peace depends on human agents
powered and driven and authorized by God’s spirit

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: new gifts around me are gifts from God

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Modern figures and the 'stump' are used as models for the hearer to emulate.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The 'Stump' (Messianic figure re-read as generic human agent)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The 'Shoot from the stump' is Christ, who alone establishes peace, which the believer then receives and reflects.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is reduced to social ethics; the human is the co-redeemer of the cosmos.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically coherent but theologically inverted; the 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) has swallowed the 'Primary Program' (Soteriology).
spanning_punten: The claim that 'peace will not be done by God from heaven' contradicts the biblical text's focus on the Messianic King.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: one neighbor act will impinge upon creation

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (Power) for the human to execute the 'Devoir' (Duty).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'business as usual' or 'tired patterns' rather than radical enmity with God.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for social activism. God is the 'Wind' in the sails, but the Human is the 'Captain' of the ship of peace.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The human is the subject of 'peacemaking'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the 'Shoot' who establishes peace.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Peace depends on human agents,' use 'Peace has been won by the Shoot of Jesse, who now enlists us in His triumph.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'Lamb' or 'Poor' who receives peace.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Focus on the hearer's inability to make peace before showing Christ's success.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Focus on Devoir (God's promise) and the 'Done' of the Gospel.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'Peace Dividend' is a gift already deposited in the bank of the Cross.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Define the opponent as the 'Powers and Principalities' or the 'Root of Sin'.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just a bad habit, we don't need a Savior, just a coach.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: Ethics is treated as the cause of cosmic restoration.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant and evocative, but it risks burdening the hearer with a cosmic task that only God can accomplish.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is 'invitational' and 'non-coercive'. Actantially, it is highly demanding because it makes the world's survival dependent on human 'odd acts'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would identify the 'Shoot' as the Davidic Messiah; the sermon democratizes this role to any 'odd agent'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'gentle' language, the underlying engine is a Pelagian structure where human performance drives the narrative.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly denies God's direct agency in the world ('peace will not be done by God from heaven'), which is a hallmark of structural moralism.
